name: Typed Formal Letter - Attorney Representation
description: Formal typed letter from attorney representing patient regarding surgical mesh complications. Clear structure, legal language.

raw_input.document_content:
MITCHELL & ASSOCIATES, P.C.
ATTORNEYS AT LAW
1200 Commerce Street, Suite 400
Dallas, TX 75201
Tel: (214) 555-8900
Fax: (214) 555-8901

January 18, 2024

VIA CERTIFIED MAIL

MeshTech Medical, Inc.
Complaint Department
500 Innovation Drive
San Diego, CA 92121

Re: Product Complaint - ProLift Surgical Mesh
    Our Client: Patricia Henderson
    Date of Implantation: March 15, 2022

Dear Sir or Madam:

This firm represents Patricia Henderson regarding injuries she has sustained as a result of your ProLift Surgical Mesh product, Model PL-500, which was implanted during a pelvic organ prolapse repair procedure on March 15, 2022, at Memorial Hospital in Houston, Texas.

Ms. Henderson has experienced severe and ongoing complications following the implantation, including:

• Chronic pelvic pain requiring narcotic medication management
• Mesh erosion through vaginal tissue (confirmed by examination on December 5, 2023)
• Recurrent urinary tract infections (five documented infections since implantation)
• Dyspareunia requiring cessation of normal marital relations
• Revision surgery on January 8, 2024, for partial mesh removal

The device serial number, as documented in her operative records, is PL5-2022-18934. The lot number is L-2022-Q1-445.

We hereby request that you:

1. Preserve all documents relating to the ProLift Surgical Mesh, Model PL-500, including but not limited to design documents, testing records, complaint files, and communications with the FDA.

2. Provide us with the complete complaint history for this device and lot number.

3. Confirm whether an MDR was filed for this incident.

Please direct all communications regarding this matter to the undersigned.

Very truly yours,

James T. Mitchell, Esq.
Mitchell & Associates, P.C.

JTM/kls
Enclosures: Medical Records Summary, Operative Reports
cc: Patricia Henderson
